text:
yeah i'd expect so, in most cases

but if we have a way to list the top N most popular packages (which i guess we do now, via PkgServer?)
then we could simply checking if the new name exactly matches `OneTwo` for all combination of packages `One` and `Two` in the top N packages?

(Top N to limit the explosion of combinations, only similarly for concat'ing 2 names -- since a single missing space between names seems a considerally more likely typo)

then we can manually merge any real one (e.g. i can imagine DataFramesJSON or JSONDataFrames being a thing, less so StaticArraysHTTP)

text: I think we can do it in linear time (linear in number of existing packages) by doing it in two steps: does `startswith(named_to_be_registered, existing_pkg_name)` hold for any `existing_pkg_name`? if so, does `name_to_be_registered[length(existing_pkg_name)+1:end]` match any other existing pkg name?
